trans-unit.source: The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS system procedure drops all existing cardinality statistics for the index that you specify or for all of the indexes on a table.

seg-source.mrk: The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS system procedure drops all existing cardinality statistics for the index that you specify or for all of the indexes on a table.

target.mrk: The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS system procedure drops all existing cardinality statistics for the index that you specify or for all of the indexes on a table.

trans-unit.source: You may want to drop the statistics if you are no longer using them or if they become incorrect for some reason. You can call the <xref href="rrefupdatestatsproc.dita#rrefupdatestatsproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</xref> or <xref href="rrefaltertablecompress.dita#rrefaltertablecompress">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COMPRESS_TABLE</xref> system procedure to recreate them, or you can wait for automatic statistics generation to begin again.

seg-source.mrk: You may want to drop the statistics if you are no longer using them or if they become incorrect for some reason.

You can call the <xref href="rrefupdatestatsproc.dita#rrefupdatestatsproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</xref> or <xref href="rrefaltertablecompress.dita#rrefaltertablecompress">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COMPRESS_TABLE</xref> system procedure to recreate them, or you can wait for automatic statistics generation to begin again.

target.mrk: You may want to drop the statistics if you are no longer using them or if they become incorrect for some reason.

You can call the <xref href="rrefupdatestatsproc.dita#rrefupdatestatsproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</xref> or <xref href="rrefaltertablecompress.dita#rrefaltertablecompress">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COMPRESS_TABLE</xref> system procedure to recreate them, or you can wait for automatic statistics generation to begin again.

trans-unit.source: For more information on cardinality statistics, see "Working with cardinality statistics" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph> guide.

seg-source.mrk: For more information on cardinality statistics, see "Working with cardinality statistics" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph> guide.

target.mrk: For more information on cardinality statistics, see "Working with cardinality statistics" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph> guide.

trans-unit.source: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128), IN INDEXNAME VARCHAR(128))

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128), IN INDEXNAME VARCHAR(128))

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128), IN INDEXNAME VARCHAR(128))

trans-unit.source: You can specify <userinput>null</userinput> for the INDEXNAME to drop all existing statistics.

seg-source.mrk: You can specify <userinput>null</userinput> for the INDEXNAME to drop all existing statistics.

target.mrk: You can specify <userinput>null</userinput> for the INDEXNAME to drop all existing statistics.

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, all users have execute privileges on this procedure. However, in order for the procedure to run successfully on a given table, the user must be the owner of either the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database</xref> or the schema in which the table resides. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, all users have execute privileges on this procedure.

However, in order for the procedure to run successfully on a given table, the user must be the owner of either the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database</xref> or the schema in which the table resides.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, all users have execute privileges on this procedure.

However, in order for the procedure to run successfully on a given table, the user must be the owner of either the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database</xref> or the schema in which the table resides.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the system procedure drops statistics for the index PAY_DESC on the SAMP.EMPLOYEE table:

target.mrk: In the following example, the system procedure drops statistics for the index PAY_DESC on the SAMP.EMPLOYEE table:

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <userinput>null</userinput> is specified instead of an index name. For all of the indexes on the EMPLOYEE table in the SAMP schema, the existing statistics are dropped.

seg-source.mrk: In the following example, <userinput>null</userinput> is specified instead of an index name.
For all of the indexes on the EMPLOYEE table in the SAMP schema, the existing statistics are dropped.

target.mrk: In the following example, <userinput>null</userinput> is specified instead of an index name.
For all of the indexes on the EMPLOYEE table in the SAMP schema, the existing statistics are dropped.
